info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 22 at 9:50PM CDT until May 9 at 4:00PM CDT by NWS New Orleans LA
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Louisiana...
Mississippi River At Donaldsonville affecting Ascension Parish.
Mississippi River At Baton Rouge affecting West Baton Rouge and East Baton Rouge Parishes.
Mississippi River At Red River Landing affecting West Feliciana, East Baton Rouge and Pointe Coupee Parishes.
Mississippi River At Reserve affecting St. John The Baptist, St. Charles and St. James Parishes.
For the Lower Mississippi River...including Red River Landing, Baton Rouge, Donaldsonville, Reserve...Major flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Mississippi River at Reserve.
* WHEN...From Thursday afternoon to Friday, May 09.
* IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, Slow-bell procedures will be enacted for river transportation.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 21.6 feet. - Bankfull stage is 15.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Thursday afternoon to a crest of 23.5 feet Thursday, May 01. It will then fall below flood stage Friday, May 09. - Flood stage is 22.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lix. Click on the Rivers and Lakes menu for forecasts and observations.
The next statement will be issued Wednesday afternoon at 200 PM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON TO FRIDAY, MAY 09

area.areaDesc: St. Charles, LA; St. James, LA; St. John The Baptist, LA
